translated: Verses of the Elder Monks 14.2
Verses of the EldersğŸ”½The Collection of XIV-Syllable Verses
The First Chapter
The Elder Godatta
Just as a fine well-bred horse,
yoked to the yoke, bearing the yoke,
when whipped beyond its capacity,
does not transgress the yoke.
So those who are content with wisdom,
like the ocean with its water,
do not despise others,
like the noble Dhamma of living beings.

not seeing things as they really are.
But those who, in regard to suffering and happiness,
in the middle, are like a scale evenly balanced,
